title: Huby Walks

images.title: Methodist Church, Huby by Pauline E, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons

images.title: Gordon Hatton / Cottages in Huby
images.caption: Cottages in Huby. The main street of Huby has a variety of houses and cottages, mostly of brick with pantile roofs. These look to be older than most, with walls of hand made brick from nearby clay pits.

images.title: Main Street, Huby by Nigel Thompson, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons

images.title: Alison Stamp / Sutton on the Forest
images.caption: Sutton on the Forest

description: This North Yorkshire village is located near York and Easingwold in the Hambleton District of the county. The village is positioned close to the North York Moors and the Howardian Hills where there's some wonderful scenery and several fine walks to try. Huby, Hambleton is not to be confused with Huby in the Harrogate district. This circular walk from the village takes you through the countryside to visit neighbouring Sutton on the Forest. Here you can enjoy stroll around Sutton Park. The 18th-century Georgian English house has some lovely landscaped gardens to explore.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: The Mended Drum serves good quality street food including some excellent burgers. They were voted York branch Pub of the Year 2019. There's car parking, a great large garden area and they are also dog friendly. You can find them on Tollerton Road at postcode YO61 1HT for your sat navs.

display_address: Gracious Street, Huby, North Yorkshire, York and North Yorkshire, England, YO61 1HR, United Kingdom
